alert.note: Alert for Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 12 at 2:11PM EDT until March 14 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 7 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Up to 1 1/2 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...In Connecticut, Southern New Haven County. In New York, Bronx, Northwest Suffolk, Northern Queens and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 7 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect up to 1 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas with the late Monday Night/early Tuesday AM high tide. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...1 to 3 ft breaking waves will result in beach erosion and flooding, particularly Orient Point. Waves splashing over bulkheads and seawalls may locally exacerbate flooding of vulnerable shoreline roadways and structures. In addition, heavy rain during the times of high tide will likely exacerbate street flooding in coastal communities.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
